p: Dog population in Central African Republic is estimated to be of approximately 80,000 animals distributed in a rather dispersed spatial pattern comprising 137 settlements divided in 58 (42%) urban and 79 (58%) rural patches ( Fig 1A). Only 10% of the total dog population lives in rural patches, whereas almost 50% is located in Bangui alone. Other top populated urban areas are Berb√©rati and Carnot in the western region of the country, accounting for 4% and 2.5% of the total dog population, and Bambari (3%) in the center-east.
